reviews.title: Best Place on Earth
reviews.text: For our honeymoon, my husband and I stayed at Leopard Hills for a week. The rooms, the food, the staff, everything is excellent. We have stayed at other game reserves and none come close to the experience we had at Leopard Hills. We saw unbelieveable animals and had amazing encounters with them. The Rangers truly love what they do, and it shows. This place is a must!

reviews.title: Cant wait to return
reviews.text: This place is amazing! My wife and i just recently returned from our honeymoon and words can not do justice to Leopard Hills. The staff, the room, the property everyhing is more then you can even imagine! TRUST ME JUST GO.

reviews.title: Safari luxury
reviews.text: The Leopard Hills resort consists of about a dozen luxurious bungalows within a compound which includes a well stocked and comfortable library, and a communal dining room.

reviews.title: Loving the Leopards!
reviews.text: The rooms are huge, with a massive bed, seating area, indoor and outdoor double shows, a patio and a plunge pool. They are tastefully decorated and very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After 3 days of walking safari with no running water or electricity, we were looking forward to the luxurious accomodations of leopard hills!
reviews.title: Heaven on Earth!

likes.liked: — Amazing wildlife viewing, awesome staff and food

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.text: We had no difficulty with the transfer to LH, the hotel staff even called in the morning of our arrival to make sure, and to inquire on the game we had already seen on our walking safari.

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.text: The accomodations are very luxurious, well appointed, and extremely spacious. We had our private pool/jacuzzi, a verendah with a hammac, an outside shower, two inside showers, and a separate bath. There was a large colonnial bed, a two-seater sofa, and a desk.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge only has 8 rooms, so its very private and personalised. But 2 rooms (#7 and #8 which is the one we had) do not have a view to the natural water hole where animals go to drink in the hot african days. Thats means that there is a lot less opportunity to see animals from the rooms, and the views are not as dramatic either. We didn't stay long so didn't matter to us, but if you are considering a longer stay, insure you have a room with a view.
reviews.title: Outstanding
